author: Jasper Hamill
title: Technology is changing middle-aged people's brains in a very unexpected way
text:
Technology is sharpening the performance of older people's minds and allowing them to think as efficiently as someone much younger, scientists have claimed.
In a paper published last night , experts claimed our brains have sped up during the internet revolution.
German scientists compared the "cognitive processing speed" of tech-addicted baby boomers and compared them to their hoary forbears, whose mental performance was tested six years ago.
They found modern-day 50-year-olds' brains were as speedy as someone aged "four to eight years younger".
Getty Keep taking the tablets: Could using an iPad keep our brains healthy?
However, all that right-swiping and double clicking has failed to boost our physical fitness, which is not improving at the same rate and may be getting worse.
“Life has become cognitively more demanding, with increasing use of communication and information technology also by older people, and people working longer in intellectually demanding jobs," said Nadia Steiber, a researcher at the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis.
"At the same time, we are seeing a decline in physical activity and rising levels of obesity.”
Getty Sharp minds: But are older people keeping their bodies in shape?
The study has been hailed as proof of the "Flynn effect", which suggests each generations' IQ is higher than their parents'.
Valeria Bordone, a researcher from the Wittgenstein Centre for Demography and Global Human Capital, added: "We show for the first time that although compositional changes of the older population in terms of education partly explain the Flynn effect, the increasing use of modern technology such as computers and mobile phones in the first decade of the 2000s also contributes considerably to its explanation.”
If grown-ups are intending to use the internet, they should probably bear one piece of advice in mind.
Please don't use the term LOL to say you found something funny, because only older folk do that now and you won't look very cool.
